abstract: The test that is running on the current task, if any.
overview:
## Discussion

If the current task is running a test, or is a subtask of another task that is running a test, the value of this property describes that test. If no test is currently running, the value of this property is `nil`.

If the current task is detached from a task that started running a test, or if the current thread was created without using Swift concurrency (e.g. by using [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/thread/2088563-detachnewthread] or [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/dispatch/dispatchqueue/2016103-async]), the value of this property may be `nil`.

# current

**Type Property**

The test that is running on the current task, if any.

## Declaration

```swift
static var current: Test? { get }
```

## Discussion

If the current task is running a test, or is a subtask of another task that is running a test, the value of this property describes that test. If no test is currently running, the value of this property is `nil`.

If the current task is detached from a task that started running a test, or if the current thread was created without using Swift concurrency (e.g. by using [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/thread/2088563-detachnewthread] or [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/dispatch/dispatchqueue/2016103-async]), the value of this property may be `nil`.
title: current
